name: Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit, A Luxury Collection Hotel

reviews.text: The very spacious room is carpeted with a reasonably comfortable bed. Has a marble-topped work desk. I particularly like the LCD TV which can be rotated 180 degrees, whether I want to watch it on the bed, seated on the sofa, at the working table or even while soaking in the bath tub. The room is reasonably well-lit at night, good for business travelers who need to work.
reviews.title: An oasis of luxury and convenience in Bangkok

reviews.text: The spacious walk-in wardrobe is a nice touch, although it would have been better if there was more space to put 2 luggage bags up. Fresh fruits provided in the room daily. We asked for side pillows, which they obliged. Daily newspaper is the International Herald Tribune which is a very good read - unlike typical newspapers back home. The room even has a coffee-maker along with an electrical kettle and takeaway cups for those who need coffee-on-the-go. 4 complimentary bottles of mineral water is provided daily, and replenished during the evening turndown service.
reviews.title: Comfort

reviews.text: Because my husband is here on a meeting package, they gave us free internet access. And we're on one of the SPG floors - the 31st floor has a fantastic view of Bangkok, and is taller than most buildings nearby. We also get complimentary local calls, which was good for making spa or massage bookings at the newly-opened Asok branch of Urban Retreat Spa just down the road (I really recommmend this place).
reviews.title: Well Located Luxury Hotel in Bangkok
Very nice indeed
reviews.text: Service is phenomenal at this Sheraton. They smile all the time and doors are constantly being opened for you. I have to say that security here seems a bit lax - it seems unlikely that the different doormen can remember the faces of different guests that enter and exit the hotel. The fact that I can walk straight from the entrance to the lifts and up to the rooms without the need for a room access card seems to me a bit unsafe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is superb and in the busy Orchid Cafe located at the lobby. My husband had dinner in Basil one night but he claims the food there appears to have been tweaked for Western tastes - not as spicy as typical roadside Thai food.
reviews.title: DEFINTELY one of the best hotel!!

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on a stopover on my way to Sydney.This is a fantastic 5 star hotel in a great location with all that you you need on your door step. The link bridge to the BTS and Metro are an added bonus( when the airport link opens in early 2010 you will be able to get to and from the airport and the Sheraton in about 30 mins). The staff are outstanding. If you are staying on a Sunday go to the Sunday jazz brunch, it's an endless oasis of almost every type of food your could wish for! The international buffet dinner is of a similar standard, comapred to the alfresco buffet dinner at the Oriental Hotel the only thing that is missing at the Sheraton Grande is the river setting. Don't waste your time looking for any other 5 star hotel in Bangkok! stay at the sheraton Grande you will not be dissaponted.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel certainly meets its five star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the SGS 3 times now and each time has been super. Twice we have had the hotel limo pick up from the airport and with the bangkok traffic it makes it a hassle free way of getting to the hotel. Check in is a breeze. Love Basil - the best thai restaurant and defintely have the soft shell crab - the best I have had in the world. Drinks at the lobby bar each night listening to Randy Cannon and his jazz group is fantastic, the bar staff are excellent. We have been coming to bangkok for years and usually stay on the river, but the SGS is now what we call home in Bangkok.
reviews.title: There is no better than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location right at the skytrain and shopping is so easy.
reviews.title: Cracking place, great location, lovely staff

reviews.text: consistency is the key! unlike many other service providers, this hotel is consistent. from the moment i stepped off the taxi, check-in, bell boy to check out, all the staff I encountered provided excellent and consistent service. this is amazing.
reviews.title: Fab hotel

reviews.text: I recently stayed in both the Sheraton and the Westin and generally agree with the Sheraton vs. Westin review comments. In terms of the service game, the Sheraton wins hands down and the larger rooms and baths of the Sheraton are appreciated, though the decor of the Westin was far more attractive to me. I agree with the comments that the Sheraton rooms feel generic and dated stylistically, although mine was immaculate and clearly nothing displayed visible wear. The Sheraton has excellent steam and sauna rooms and the pool is far more elaborate than the Westin, though the Westin's is more practical for a legitimate swim. Both have great BTS access, though the noise of the trains is audible on the front sides of the hotels unless you are on the very highest floors. This Sheraton is a member of Starwood's vaunted Luxury Collection properties and it does appear in the 2009 Conde Nast Reader's Choice Awards, and I've always found that recognition a great litmus test of quality. I agree with the score it received, which certainly places it among an elite group, but certainly not close to the world's very finest.
reviews.title: Sheraton vs. Westin vs. Others-Take II
Best Hotel in the World
reviews.text: An important note is the construction of a very large property that faces what I consider the back of the Westin and the front of the Sheraton. Even on weekends, work continues until close to midnight, so unless you are a heavy sleeper, ask for the quiet side of either hotel. It appears construction will go on for many months.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While both of these properties are fine facilities, you might consider other properties because neither of these are really walkable to key tourist sites or shopping. Granted the BTS is handy, but you must ride one line for shopping or connect and use two lines if you want to ride the memorable river ferries. Traffic is atrocious so taxis aren't a very good solution, not so much because of cost but because of the time wasted.
reviews.title: Generic 5 star

reviews.text: where the hotel shines are its restaurants as well as its service, but in particular their restaurants where the food is excellent.
reviews.title: This property does the Sheraton brand proud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice spa, gym and pool area complement the facilities of the hotel, which gives you more a resort feeling rather than a business hotel, despite being situated in one of the most busiest spots of Bangkok.
reviews.title: Great price, great stay - but unique time

reviews.text: I've stayed in 5 star hotels in about 10 different countries around the world and the Sheraton Grande would have to be the best.
reviews.title: The best hotel I've stayed in

reviews.text: Its best feature is the swimming pool. You don't forget that you're in Bangkok, it's like an oasis.
reviews.title: I Will Return

reviews.text: The room is amazing - i was on the top floor in a king room with a great view of the city - the room has everything that you could possibly ask for - flat screen tv dvd player weight scales coffee maker fresh fruit daily iron and board everything.
reviews.title: Chase the good one

reviews.text: The breaskfast here is amazing ! There is no end of food on offer and no one will ever walk away empty ! I can well recommend the buffet..
reviews.title: Recommend staying at Sheraton Grande Sulhumvit Bangkok

reviews.text: Pool area is small but very cosy with lots of plants and hideaway areas - not that you want to spend alot of time here with an amazing city out the door.
reviews.title: A really first class hotel - a rare pleasure to stay in.

description: Located on Sukhumvit Road in the heart of Bangkok with a walkway connecting the hotel lobby to the convenience of the Skytrain and the MRT underground, guests are moments away from enriching cultural sights, palatial shopping malls, a cosmopolitan dining scene and vibrant nightlife.
